DOC.brief_summary: The primary aim is to study the relationship between vascular function, cardiovascular fitness and age in healthy subjects. Individuals with the highest cardiovascular fitness will have the greatest arterial inflow independent of age.
DOC.brief_title: Cardiovascular Fitness and Venous Function in Trained and Untrained Subjects
DOC.criteria: Healthy subjects, 1875 years of age Inability to exercise due to musculoskeletal conditions Known ischemic cardiovascular disease Smoking or tobacco use Acute medical conditions Active infections Pharmacotherapy with known vascular effects
